{"step_by_step_thinking": "Oseltamivir, also known as Tamiflu, is an antiviral medication used to treat and prevent influenza A and B. It works by inhibiting the enzyme neuraminidase, which is a protein on the surface of influenza viruses that enables the virus to be released from the host cell. Inhibition of M2 receptor, RNA dependent DNA polymerase, and apoptosis of infected cells are not the mechanisms of action for Oseltamivir.", "answer_choice": "B. Neuraminidase inhibition"}
